questions.question_text: Which three of these statements regarding 802.1Q trunking are correct? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: I think ADE is the correct answer

Explanation:
By default, 802.1Q trunk defined Native VLAN in order to forward unmarked frame. Switches can forward Layer 2 frame from Native VLAN on unmarked trunks port. Receiver switches will transmit all unmarked packets to Native VLAN. Native VLAN is the default VLAN configuration of port. Note for the 802.1Q trunk ports between two devices, the same Native VLAN configuration is required on both sides of the link. If the Native VLAN in 802.1Q trunk ports on same trunk link is properly configured, it could lead to layer 2 loops. The 802.1Q trunk link transmits VLAN information through Ethernet.

choices.A: 802.1Q native VLAN frames are untagged by default.
choices.E: 802.1Q trunks should have native VLANs that are the same at both ends.
choices.B: 802.1Q trunking ports can also be secure ports.
choices.C: 802.1Q trunks can use 10 Mb/s Ethernet interfaces.

questions.answer_description: CCNA Self-Study (ICND Exam): Extending Switched Networks with Virtual LANs http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=102157&seqNum=2

comments.content:
A protocol can definitely be a method, why not? You have different protocols, so different methods of communicating. Ethernet is a LAN connectivity method, but you do have PPPoE of course. Cisco calls PPP a method too:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/tech/wan/point-to-point-protocol-ppp/index.html

discussion.content:
I think C and E because PPP is a protocol not a connectivity method.
DSL and Ethernet are two valid WAN connectivity method.

questions.question_text: Which two options are valid WAN connectivity methods? (Choose two.)
questions.answer_description:
On each WAN connection, data is encapsulated into frames before it crosses the WAN link. The following are typical WAN protocols:1. High-level Data Link
Control (HDLC): The Cisco default encapsulation type on point-to-point connections, dedicated links, and circuit-switches connections.2. PPP: Provides router-to- router and host-to-network connections over synchronous and asynchronous circuits. PPP was designed to work with several network layer protocols, including
IP.3. Frame-relay: A successor to X.25. This protocol is an industry-standard, switchesdata-link layer protocol that handles multiple virtual circuits http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wide_area_network http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=102157&seqNum=2

choices.D: Reduce the MTU on edge-1 to 1500.
choices.A: Set the subnet mask on edge-1 to 255.255.255.252.
choices.B: Reduce the MTU on edge-1 to 1514.
choices.E: Configure the ip ospf mtu-ignore command on the edge-1 Gi0/0 interface.
choices.C: Set the OSPF cost on edge-1 to 1522.

discussion.content:
The interface command ip ospf mtu-ignore disables this check of the MTU value in the OSPF DBD packets. Thus, use of this command allows the OSPF adjacency to reach the FULL state even though there is an interface MTU mismatch between two OSPF routers.
To make the MTU match you could reduce the MTU on R1.

/31 is valid on point to point connections as we see above.

Cost values do not need to match.

D and E are correct

OSPF does not reach full adjacency when there is a mismatch in MTU
However you configure an ignore command to allow mismatched interfaces to connect
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/open-shortest-path-first-ospf/119384-technote-ospf-00.html
a /31 doesn't give 2 valid host changing the subnet mask should be an answer

comments.content:
I don't think that it is shown at CCNA level but you can use a /31 address for point to point links.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3021
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/ipaddr_ipv4/configuration/xe-3s/asr903/ipv4-xe-3s-asr903-book/config-ipv4-addr.html
RFC 3021 defines it as a valid subnet for point to point links

questions.answer_description:
The Router ID (RID) is an IP address used to identify the router and is chosen using the following sequence:
+ The highest IP address assigned to a loopback (logical) interface.
+ If a loopback interface is not defined, the highest IP address of all active router's physical interfaces will be chosen.
+ The router ID can be manually assigned
In this case, because a loopback interface is not configured so the highest active IP address 192.168.0.1 is chosen as the router ID.

discussion.content: A is the highest active ip address on the router, if there was a loopback address then the loopback would take preference

hi everyone,
Here coming to the IP address and router those are the https://19216801.pro/ the uncontrolled and un sequence some of the settings connected to the router are the most eligant and typicall the setting of these routers

comments.content: A is the highest active IP of all interfaces -192.168.0.1

discussion.content: D - is the highest active ip address

questions.answer_description:
The question mentioned Boston router was not configured correctly or incomplete so we should check this router first. Click on PC-B to access the command line interface (CLI) of Boston router.
(type cisco as its password here)

Boston>enable -

Boston#show running-config -

First, remember that the current OSPF Process ID is 2 because we will need it for later configuration. Next notice that in the second "network" command the network and wildcard mask are 192.168.155.0 and 0.0.0.3 which is equivalent to 192.168.155.0 255.255.255.252 in term of subnet mask. Therefore, this subnetworks range is from 192.168.155.0 to 192.168.155.3 but the ip address of s0/0 interface of Boston router is 192.168.155.5 which dont belong to this range
-> this is the reason why OSPF did not recognize s0 interface of Boston router as a part of area 0. So we need to find a subnetwork that s0 interface belongs to.
IP address of S0 interface: 192.168.155.5/30
Subnet mask:/30 = 1111 1111.1111 1111.1111 1111.1111 1100

Increment: 4 -
Network address (which IP address of s0 interface belongs to): 192.168.155.4 (because 4 * 1 = 4 < 5)
Therefore, we must use this network instead of 192.168.155.0 network

Finally, you should issue a ping command from Boston router to Lancaster router to make sure it works well.
Boston#ping 192.168.43.1

discussion.content:
The answer is clear and easy to understand. 

However, there is a mistake in the question, quoting "Lancaster router" instead of "Boston router" as in the resolution and explanation. 
===================

In the question: 

" ..... The Lancaster router was recently installed but connectivity is not complete because of incomplete routing tables. Identify and correct any problem you see in the configuration."

questions.question_text:
SIMULATION -

Lab OSPF -
A sporting goods manufacturer has decided to network three (3) locations to improve efficiency in inventory control. The routers have been named to reflect the location: Boston, Frankfurt, Lancaster. The necessary networking has been completed at each location, and the routers have been configured with single area
OSPF as the routing protocol. The Lancaster router was recently installed but connectivity is not complete because of incomplete routing tables. Identify and correct any problem you see in the configuration.
Note: The OSPF process must be configured to allow interfaces in specific subnets to participate in the routing process.
//IMG//
